locations_established.Port_Security_Office: Windowless room, camera feed monitors, meeting with customs agent

themes_developed.invisibility_through_pattern: Service workers invisible through routine. Criminals timed operations to look like normal disruptions.
themes_developed.data_exhaust_as_weapon: Training data legally purchased to create illegal tools. Public safety information (maintenance schedules) weaponized.
themes_developed.human_obsolescence: Night shift workers aged by automation rhythms. Sara's father and invisible workers parallel. Workers exploited while doing jobs correctly.
themes_developed.legal_infrastructure_enabling_crime: Training data markets, public schedules, contractor access all legal but exploitable

tone_notes: Technical deep dive balanced with human investigation. Emil's apartment shows his paranoia and expertise. Sara's pattern recognition developing - sees invisible infrastructure. Nordic noir atmosphere of competent people outmatched systematically. Dmitri's night shift fatigue shows human cost. Building tension toward Chen Wei meeting. Sara avoiding grief through work. No melodrama, just accumulating realization of being behind. Chapter ends with hope (breakthrough) and danger (trap?) in balance.
